div.style: background-size: cover; background-position: center center; background-image: url(https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/h3oQTcUcNYo1SacNuPCshU3VTp-GbaW2UJDRyGMwgdQmjrxoDClxYAJO5phEKSGc1FaP7A0=w16383);

div.h3: "Striving for Excellence Today to Prepare Students for a Challenging World Tomorrow."

div.p: First, thank you for your efforts and patience as we work through this difficult time trying to serve our students.

ul.li: Governor Bullock has announced an extension of school closure for another two weeks through April 24th. A reminder the Governors order only allows school employees and board members when conducting meetings to be in the school. It is a violation of the order to allow students, guests, children, or other friends and family inside the school buildings through at least April 24th. Board meetings will be conducted electronically until the closure is lifted. You can participate by phone, email or device.

The next INCOMING ASSIGNMENTS due date will be April 14th. The teachers individual in-boxes will be outside the buildings in alphabetical order and placed for social distancing. In the event teachers have an assignment or some other material for student pick-up, it will be available next to the teachers hand-in box in a separate container on April 14.

If students need to hand-in assignments at any other time, they can use the incoming assignments tote outside the front door of the high school, or the elementary back door beyond the outside kitchen door under the overhang.

Parents please have your students write the teachers name at the top of an assignment to be handed in. It also helps to check that your students put their names on their incoming assignments. The assignments that are delivered to the incorrect teacher delays grading and creates confusion. Please clip or staple papers together.

Your students have all assignment materials through the end of the month. May 1 will be the final day for handing in materials not yet handed in for students who are proficient, or passing 60% or above. Students who are not proficient will be notified by teachers after May 1st and they will continue school until May 21st. If the closure is lifted, they will need to report to school. Summer school or MTDA credit recovery may be necessary to become proficient.

Items to be picked up anytime by students or parents will be placed in an OUTGOING ASSIGNMENTS tote placed at both schools. Teachers may be putting graded work or items to be picked up by students/parents in this tote. Teachers will be notifying students/parents that items can be picked up.
Reminder: Range may be able to provide free internet to students who do not have it. Contact jessica.kuipers@rangetel.coop (406-347-2226) or jason.wille@rangefamily.net (307-675-0909).

Spring Events If school closure is not lifted on May 5th, the spring sports season will be cancelled. We are hoping graduation will happen, but will not know until the next board meeting on May 4th and will be determined by school closure being lifted.

div.p: Please contact teachers or the school ASAP if you have any questions, concerns, or if there is something we can do to help. We will get through this together! Thank you for your hard work, patience and support.
